item.title: basketball games campaign
item.client: The following project was made with cooperation with the Basketball Federation of Slovenia (KZS).
item.about:
The following project was made with cooperation with the Basketball Federation of Slovenia (KZS).

The project aimed to design marketing material for the upcoming qualification games for the 2019 FIBA Basketball World Cup.

We were designing billboards, mockups and other promotional materials. This part consisted of a
Among all submitted entries, the client adopted ours. The posters and billboards we designed were advertised at various locations throughout the country until the start of the games.

item.title: huawei emui theme design
item.about:
The aim was to create and design an EMUI Theme for Huawei. The final product should draw parallels from and resemble the country of Slovenia.

A total number of themes I executed and made responsive were eight. The client launched them with a promotion campaign titled “Slovene talents”.

Our group designed a soft and illustrative theme with the city of Ljubljana’s skyline in the background along with over 50 customised icons.

The number of downloads in the first quarter was over 200 000. Most of them from Europe and Russia.
item.credits:
Tjaša Blažko
Janja Cerar
Nina Šalomon
Jure Ahtik
Tanja Nuša Kočevar

item.title: universitas typofoto exhibition
item.client: At the end of the semester, we were invited to make a debut and present our typofoto projects in gallery-type space called Vodnikova Domačija. Exhibited designs were themed on the University of Ljubljana in honour of their 100th anniversary.
item.about:
I volunteered to come up with the idea for the event, design the invitations and carry out the promotion on social media.

I delivered a rather simple, yet non-typical presentation of an event. It was made with a 3D render of the main building of the university. The main element of which would later be modified for different needed formats.

The opening was successful and has been later moved to our faculty facilities to be exhibited.

item.title: plecnik inspired packaging
item.client: Comprised of various building around the city, the Museum and Galleries of Ljubljana is a creative and modern institution with close links to its environment. One of such establishments is the Plečnik House, a historic building, once home to the famous architect Jože Plečnik, who left an indelible mark on the cityscape of Ljubljana. The Plečnik House was preparing a new exhibition called »Plečnik as inspiration«.
item.about:
With their new exhibition on the way, the client wanted a new limited edition packaging design for the jewellery, sold at the gift shop. The aim was to design a creative and unique solution that tells the story of the architect. The finished products had to be environmentally friendly and easy to make.

I designed and prototyped three different ideas for the packaging. Two of which were chosen by the client. They were exhibited and are now sold along with the jewellery.

item.title: website design for domacija jezek
item.client: Domačija Ježek is a small touristic homestead a few kilometres from the city centre of Ljubljana. They offer accommodations for people looking for a peaceful atmosphere in the countryside, workshops and venues for business meetings and weddings.
item.about:
Since their original website was very outdated, they requested a more modern and dynamic approach. As a result of their comprehensive range of offers, the new design should be clean and user friendly so that the target group could easily navigate around the site and find new events and offers which have been thus far carried out exclusively on social media.

To capture the atmosphere of the place we went multiple times to the location to take photos and to interview the owners. The aim was to make a responsive website prototype for different screen sizes.

The delivered product was a modern and clean design with a big focus on user-friendliness.

item.title: website design for kazu
item.client: Carinthia’s Academy of Sciences and Arts is a smaller organization of approximately eighty educators and experts from different backgrounds. The institution organizes various free workshops and events to encourage the collaboration between its members.
item.about:
The purpose of the project was to update their original website - to make it more attractive and modern with simple and clean information architecture. The new website should appeal and bring more attention to students and youth.

The aim was to make a responsive website prototype for various screen sizes. The biggest challenge was organising their extensive content and breaking it up to smaller groups. We tried our best to increase legibility and readability.

We delivered a modern design that is user friendly and uses vivid colours to attract the user.

Every information we put on the website was well-thought-out and based on the extended analysis.

item.title: japanese movie poster design
item.about:
The task was to design an illustrative poster based on a movie called »The Ballad of Narayama« set in a small rural village in the 19th century Japan.

The results were various formations of a poster/collage of pictures and illustrations. The idea was to show what life used to be like at that time.

item.title: dont forget how to calligraphy
item.about:
The main goal of this project was to digitalize existing well-known calligraphy fonts. The ones I chose were Fraktur, Textura Quadrata, Foundational hand and the Carolingian minuscule. The purpose of the project was to learn and practice calligraphy and use them for various experimentations with creations and effects.

Exported over one hundred designed glyphs from the chosen fonts. I also made brushes for the app Procreate and practice sheets that accompanied each font.

As from now, fonts can be used as a base, but I am planning on extending the range of glyphs and make them available for download.

item.title: fossil inspired display font
item.client: This was a school project I worked on. We were asked to design a font and the idea had to be based on rocks and pedology.
item.about: I designed a bold and bulky patterned linear font where each symbol has a unique pattern. The idea (like the name suggests) was inspired by random prints that fossils leave on rocks.

item.title: espresso: illy, domori, dammann
item.client: Espresso is Slovenia’s only distributor of prestigious illy coffee, Dammann teas and Domori chocolate.
item.about:
The client requested original ideas for their future marketing campaigns and a refreshed and modern look for their online presence.

I worked in a group of three. In the beginning, my job was to analyze the company and its competition and later to come up with new ideas and design prototypes. After we pitched the proposed mock-ups, my task was to design and edit the photos of our solution.

Out of eight final pitches, the client choose ours.

In the final pitch, we presented a redesigned and responsive prototype of their website. We also proposed an idea and made mockups for a mobile app that could help users discover the client’s story.
